title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Frederick S. Tukey to John A. McDonnell, February 4, 1867
summary: Tukey refutes the various charges made against him in this lengthy statement to McDonnell. In it he gives his own account of events, calling McDonnell's attention to various statements and other evidence.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Aid/Relief, Church/Religious Activity, Education, Family, Legal System, Patriotism, Politics/Political Attitudes, Property, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, Women, American Civil War
